title: Fish-shaped pastry
text: Fish-shaped pastry refers to the Japanese pastry <a href="Taiyaki">Taiyaki</a>, which is shaped to resemble a <a href="bream">bream</a> or <a href="Asian%20carp">Asian carp</a>, and then is filled with <a href="red%20bean%20paste">red bean paste</a> or other fillings like custard or chocolate. It is derived from the similar Japanese pastry called <a href="Imagawayaki">Imagawayaki</a>. It is also popular in other East Asian countries such as: South Korea where it is known as <a href="bungeoppang">bungeoppang</a>.
